question: 昆布
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Insect</kanji> <kanji>cloth</kanji> is actually <vocabulary>konbu</vocabulary>. <vocabulary>Konbu seaweed</vocabulary> is very common in Japan, and it's delicious. And insects happen to love using it as cloth, too. They make all their clothes out of konbu.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The <ja>布</ja> part gets changed to <ja>ぶ</ja>, probably because if a food doesn't have <vocabulary>konbu</vocabulary> you say <reading>boo</reading> (<ja>ぶ</ja>).
